item.title: Eclipse DemoCamp and Maker Faire Trondheim 2014
item.author: keilw
item.description:
After a great Eclipse DemoCamp Trondheim last year, I was invited to talk about UOMo, JSR 363 and the Quantified Self at Eclipse Luna DemoCamp Trondheim

We continued with a practical exercise of measuring a few "Pints" in the city. Interestingly after my "Measure for Measure" themed talk the pub was named "Macbeth" just like the other (probably more famous) play by William Shakespeare;-)

The following day, the Force (in Newton;-D) was very strong with me, when I presented the improved version of Heart of Glass from last year's JavaOne Raspberry Pi Challenge at Trondheim Maker Faire.

I offered to measure his pulse and heart rate, but he didn't want to get out of his body armor;-D

item.title: EclipseCon France
item.author: keilw
item.description:
EclipseCon France 2014 in Toulouse was an opportunity to present JSR 363 and what it means to the UOMo project at the Science WG Unconference Meeting

It was also a chance to meet Co Spec Lead Jean-Marie Dautelle (below on the left) in his home town.

The following day Jean-Marie pressented Javolution, and projects using it like JScience in a lightning talk on how it can improve scalability.

item.title: First EG F2F during JCP EC F2F in London
item.author: keilw
item.description: Leonardo, Mohamed and Werner as well as Bruno representing SouJava (where members started to get involved via Adopt-a-JSR) met for a first EG F2F in the course of the May JCP EC F2F at Goldmann Sachs in London.

item.title: World IoT Day
item.author: keilw
item.description:
After JSR 363 passed the Creation Review, the first public presentation took part on World IoT Day 2014. I visited IoT MeetUp Zurich.

The hosts were quite honored to have someone from outside Switzerland come by, and we all enjoyed Thai Curry cooked in a Raspberry Pi powered EveryCook device.

item.title: JSR 363 Accepted
item.author: keilw
item.description:
The JCP Executive Committee has accepted the Creation of JSR 363.

See https://jcp.org/en/jsr/results?id=5666

item.title: NightHacking at JUGS
item.author: keilw
item.description: A NightHacking session with Stephen Chin later that week allowed a more detailed overview of JSR 363. Duke got so excited, he even temporarily lost his head;-)

item.title: JavaLand
item.author: keilw
item.description:
A NightHacking interview at JavaLand
conference brought the first public announcement of JSR 363.

item.title: Creation Review
item.author: keilw
item.description:
The Creation Review of JSR 363 by the JCP Executive Committee and Java Community started.

See https://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=363

item.title: JCP EC F2F at Oracle HQ
item.author: keilw
item.description:
Werner Keil and Leonardo Lima presented the idea of a Units of Measurement JSR to the JCP Executive Committee in Redwood Shores, CA.

M2M, Sensor Web, Observations and Measurements from Werner Keil

Units of Measurement presented at Pecha Kucha Night Frankfurt (DE).
